author: pk910
content:
These are slashable blocks. But there is no slasher in the network... 
I've stopped my slasher again to not break the network ðŸ˜‰

author: barnabasbusa
content: Slashing occured due to our temp setup for replacing the prysm validators while they had trouble syncing, yesterday we deployed a new version of prysm which managed to sync to head, while forgetting to shut down the temp nodes. It was an oversight from my side, and it was nicely catched! Great work <@808969530608451584>.

author: trimetilo
content:
We've had an incident at blobscan.com because of it and we have stopped processing new slots.

Could you advice us on what is the best strategy to follow in order to discard forked blocks? What do other block explorer do?

https://github.com/Blobscan/blobscan-indexer.rs/issues/19#issuecomment-1693327607

author: ppf.
content: we do not store blocks with uniq numbers

author: pk910
content: I'm storing blocks with block root as primary key.  slot is an index,  but not unique
